title: Towel, 19th–early 20th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton foundation
Technique: uncounted stitches; double running and satin stitches on plain weave; bobbin lace
description: Towel with a four and a half inch embroidered border at each end. The borders, which are identical, have a non-repeating design of flowers and leaves in shades of red, green, blue and metallic silver. The lower border, about an inch high, has a repeating design of curving vines. Each end of the towel is trimmed with gold metallic bobbin lace is sewn across the bottom and four inches up each side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Towel, 19th–early 20th century.Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton foundation
Technique: uncounted stitches; double running and satin stitches on plain weave; bobbin lace. 1974-76-3.
